author: Michael Larabel
description: As expected, Linus Torvalds just released the Linux 6.17 kernel on-schedule as the kernel version powering Ubuntu 25.10, Fedora 43, and other upcoming Linux distribution releases and rolling releases...
title: Linux 6.17 Released: Intel Panther Lake Xe3 Graphics Ready, New Optimizations

author: Michael Larabel
description: Ahead of the stable Linux 6.17 kernel release expected in the coming hours, Bcachefs lead developer Kent Overstreet put out a blog post around the current multi-Linux distribution support for the out-of-tree DKMS packages for this copy-on-write file-system, some of their plans moving forward, and still aiming to graduate from the "experimental" phase at the end of the year...
title: Bcachefs Announces First-Tier Arch & NixOS Support, Post-Experimental Release EOY

author: Michael Larabel
description: GraalVM has been an interesting and performant Java JDK that over time added support for additional programming languages and execution models. Following their 2022 announcement that GraalVM CE Java code would be donated to OpenJDK, Oracle recently announced that moving forward GraalVM will focus on non-Java languages...
title: Oracle's GraalVM To Shift Focus To Non-Java Languages Like Python & JavaScript

author: Michael Larabel
description: There is a lot coming for AMD processors with the Linux 6.18 kernel. Of the early pull requests submitted in advance of the planned Linux 6.17 kernel release later today, there are a number of changes already lined up with some exciting AMD CPU feature additions for the next kernel version. These AMD changes for Linux 6.18 are all the more important with that kernel expected to become this year's Long Term Support (LTS) kernel version...
title: Linux 6.18 To Deliver Many Notable Features For AMD CPUs

author: Michael Larabel
description: Adding to the list of pull requests submitted early in advance of the Linux 6.18 merge window opening are several cryptography-related improvements. In particular, some nice performance optimizations once again for the Linux kernel...
title: Cryptography Performance Improvements Coming For Linux 6.18

author: Michael Larabel
description: Introduced two years ago was the Intel/Codeplay oneAPI Construction Kit for helping to bring SYCL support to new hardware. As part of that the oneAPI Construction Kit was brought to RISC-V and other platforms. Out this week is now oneAPI Construction Kit 5.0 and sadly it drops Vulkan API support...
title: The oneAPI Construction Kit Drops Support For Vulkan

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the release earlier this year of the Fish 4.0 shell that was ported from C++ to Rust, Fish 4.1 was released this weekend as the next major feature release...
title: Fish 4.1 Released With Nearly 1,400 Commits To This Rust-Based Shell

author: Michael Larabel
description: All of the ARM64 feature changes intended for the Linux 6.18 merge window have been submitted in advance. There are a few new features worth calling out for 64-bit ARM Linux users...
title: ARM64 With Linux 6.18 To Accept Secrets From Firmware & More
